https://nypost.com/2022/03/14/nyc-dc-mayors-adams-bowser-urge-homeless-to-get-off-streets-to-avoid-shooter/

The mayors of New York City and Washington, DC urged their cities‚Äô homeless populations to seek shelter Sunday as a ‚Äúcold-blooded killer‚Äù who had shot at least five vagrants remained on the loose.

A lone gunman is suspected of targeting sleeping homeless men in a series of shootings in DC and the Big Apple this month that has so far left two men dead and three others wounded.

New York Mayor Eric Adams and DC Mayor Muriel Bowser said they were coordinating with federal authorities to investigate the crimes before he strikes again.

_source.content: Man Calls 911 After Being Shot In Arm, Cops Show Up, Runs Over Him, Killing Him ‚Äì No Charges (Video)-*another story of to Serve & Protect*-Sons of Liberty OH ‚Äî A year ago, on June 13, 2021, 42-year-old Eric Cole called 911 for help, like he was supposed to do, after he was shot in the arm. However, police were the first to show up on the scene and help was the last thing Cole received. In fact, he received the exact opposite ‚Äî and it killed him.Police Chief Lee Graf referred to the negligence of one of his officers, Amanda Rosales, as an ‚Äúaccident,‚Äù which left Cole dead. While it may not have been on purpose, dashcam video shows it was completely avoidable. Eric Cole lie bleeding on the ground from a gunshot wound to the forearm when officer Rosales drove her cruiser on top of the man in need.‚ÄúThis was an accident,‚Äù Graf said. ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt mean it is okay.‚ÄùApparently, a grand jury bought the narrative hook, line, and sinker, and this week, following an ‚Äúinvestigation,‚Äù criminal charges were thrown out.‚ÄúThe grand jury determined that the incident surrounding Mr. Cole‚Äôs death was tragic, but not criminal,‚Äù Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost said.‚ÄúThe lead officer was trying to catch addresses on the house, Eric was lying in the street, as you can see in the videos and the officer did not see him,‚Äù said Graf at the time, paving the way for what happened this week.Though Graf calls Cole‚Äôs death an accident, the family says it was not.‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way in hell that she did not freaking see him,‚Äù said Lekesha Bradford, Cole‚Äôs sister, according to Dayton Now.‚ÄúI want the officer held accountable, just like if they get the suspect, they‚Äôre going to hold them accountable,‚Äù said Regina Wilson, Cole‚Äôs mom.‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no excuse for what‚Äôs happened,‚Äù said John Moore, Cole‚Äôs best friend. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen all it. My eyes don‚Äôt lie. You can‚Äôt lie to me I‚Äôve seen what went on.‚Äù  ‚ÄúWe will get justice, I will guarantee you,‚Äù said a representative of the family with Springfield NAACP Division last year. ‚ÄúWe will definitely get justice.‚ÄùUnfortunately, all their calls for justice fell on deaf ears.Illustrating the nature of police to circle the wagons to conceal the negligence of one of their own, immediately after Cole‚Äôs death, they issued a statement saying they didn‚Äôt know whether the police cruiser or the bullet killed Cole.Cole was shot in his left forearm,  hardly a deadly situation. However, when a 6,000 pound police cruiser runs over you, it is often deadly and according to the Montgomery County Coroner‚Äôs Office autopsy report, it was the cruiser that killed Cole, not the bullet in his arm."He was shot in the arm,‚Äù said Moore. ‚ÄúA shot in the arm isn‚Äôt going to kill somebody, somebody is going to bounce back from that. But we hide this (a police cruiser hitting him). Why did we hide this?‚ÄùSee Concl.
_source.contentraw:
Man Calls 911 After Being Shot In Arm, Cops Show Up, Runs Over Him, Killing Him ‚Äì No Charges (Video)-*another story of to Serve & Protect*-Sons of Liberty

OH ‚Äî A year ago, on June 13, 2021, 42-year-old Eric Cole called 911 for help, like he was supposed to do, after he was shot in the arm. However, police were the first to show up on the scene and help was the last thing Cole received. In fact, he received the exact opposite ‚Äî and it killed him.
Police Chief Lee Graf referred to the negligence of one of his officers, Amanda Rosales, as an ‚Äúaccident,‚Äù which left Cole dead. While it may not have been on purpose, dashcam video shows it was completely avoidable. Eric Cole lie bleeding on the ground from a gunshot wound to the forearm when officer Rosales drove her cruiser on top of the man in need.
‚ÄúThis was an accident,‚Äù Graf said. ‚ÄúDoesn‚Äôt mean it is okay.‚Äù
Apparently, a grand jury bought the narrative hook, line, and sinker, and this week, following an ‚Äúinvestigation,‚Äù criminal charges were thrown out.
‚ÄúThe grand jury determined that the incident surrounding Mr. Cole‚Äôs death was tragic, but not criminal,‚Äù Ohio Attorney General Dave Yost said.
‚ÄúThe lead officer was trying to catch addresses on the house, Eric was lying in the street, as you can see in the videos and the officer did not see him,‚Äù said Graf at the time, paving the way for what happened this week.
Though Graf calls Cole‚Äôs death an accident, the family says it was not.
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no way in hell that she did not freaking see him,‚Äù said Lekesha Bradford, Cole‚Äôs sister, according to Dayton Now.
‚ÄúI want the officer held accountable, just like if they get the suspect, they‚Äôre going to hold them accountable,‚Äù said Regina Wilson, Cole‚Äôs mom.
‚ÄúThere‚Äôs no excuse for what‚Äôs happened,‚Äù said John Moore, Cole‚Äôs best friend. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôve seen all it. My eyes don‚Äôt lie. You can‚Äôt lie to me I‚Äôve seen what went on.‚Äù ‚ÄúWe will get justice, I will guarantee you,‚Äù said a representative of the family with Springfield NAACP Division last year. ‚ÄúWe will definitely get justice.‚Äù
Unfortunately, all their calls for justice fell on deaf ears.
Illustrating the nature of police to circle the wagons to conceal the negligence of one of their own, immediately after Cole‚Äôs death, they issued a statement saying they didn‚Äôt know whether the police cruiser or the bullet killed Cole.
Cole was shot in his left forearm, hardly a deadly situation. However, when a 6,000 pound police cruiser runs over you, it is often deadly and according to the Montgomery County Coroner‚Äôs Office autopsy report, it was the cruiser that killed Cole, not the bullet in his arm.
"He was shot in the arm,‚Äù said Moore. ‚ÄúA shot in the arm isn‚Äôt going to kill somebody, somebody is going to bounce back from that. But we hide this (a police cruiser hitting him). Why did we hide this?‚Äù
See Concl.

_source.content: Is Shared Child Custody Always the Optimal Choice for Families? Joint custody, often known as shared custody, is the top pick for most parents in the vast majority of instances. Making agreements for joint child custody is not only significantly simpler than engaging in protracted litigation but also far less expensive. Most of us are not millionaires, and attorneys are not inexpensive these days. It is definitely in the best interests of the children that these things are resolved swiftly and that everyone can go on with their life. Unfortunately, shared child custody is not always the best option, and in extreme cases, it may not be a choice at all. If at all possible, you should always prioritize shared custody. The findings indicate that children who maintain touch with both parents recover from the divorce far more quickly. Obviously, it is also crucial for a youngster to have two rather than just one role model. Numerous boys, for instance, have been discovered to have issues at a later age if they have lost permanent contact with their father. Joint custody is the healthiest option for the children, despite the fact that it might be challenging for the parent. Although courts typically favor joint custody agreements, it is not always viable to have joint custody. If you believe, for example, that your children would not be safe with the other parent, you should not choose shared custody. This might be due to an alcohol or drug issue. There is also a potential that the youngsters might be subjected to some form of maltreatment. If you feel that your children are not secure with the other parent for any reason, you should really do all in your power to obtain custody of your children. Even visiting privileges for the other parent might be denied until they get their lives in order. With more than 20years of experience, Mr. Eric M Nakasu can help you establish your rights while seeking the best possible outcome. Our family law attorneys at Eric Child Custody work hard to make sure our clients' needs are met. Our Family Law Attorney Anaheim, CA, understands how essential & crucial it is to get desired results.  So we will work diligently on your case & ensure we achieve positive outcomes for our clients. We handle divorce, custody disputes, paternity issues, spousal support matters, and other family law matters throughout Orange County. Call 1-714-916-9800 for an appointment.https://ericccl.com/

card.title: Zelenskyy spoke at a Ukraine benefit auction organised by Sean Penn, where someone paid $1 million for a private John Legend concert

_source.content: "President Volodymyr Zelenskyy gave a speech at a Sean Penn-organized benefit night for Ukraine, which included a million-dollar auction bid on a private John Legend performance.¬†Speaking via a pre-recorded video speech, Zelenskyy told the supporters of Penn's CORE charity of the "peaceful cities and villages wiped off the face of the earth" in Ukraine.¬†He described how Russian forces had destroyed "schools, hospitals, theaters, museums, entire streets and neighborhoods." A video montage played, showing devastation in Ukraine as well as more optimistic scenes."All of this is not the scenery of a blockbuster about the apocalypse," he told the audience at the Hollywood Palladium, who,¬†per Variety, were largely wealthy media figures. "All of this is our reality."A video uploaded by Zelenskyy's office shows the speech intercut with audience reactions:Former President Bill Clinton, Sharon Stone, and Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti were among attendees at the dinner event, which also featured a performance by John Legend, Variety reported. Legend played Bob Marley's "Redemption Song" on piano, according to the outlet.¬†It is unclear how much was raised in the auction, but one bidder managed to spend $1 million on a private home performance from Legend, per Variety."  https://businessinsider.com/zelenskyy-spoke-at-sean-penn-ukraine-fundraiser-raised-1m-2022-6
_source.contentraw:
"President Volodymyr Zelenskyy gave a speech at a Sean Penn-organized benefit night for Ukraine, which included a million-dollar auction bid on a private John Legend performance. 

Speaking via a pre-recorded video speech, Zelenskyy told the supporters of Penn's CORE charity of the "peaceful cities and villages wiped off the face of the earth" in Ukraine. 

He described how Russian forces had destroyed "schools, hospitals, theaters, museums, entire streets and neighborhoods." A video montage played, showing devastation in Ukraine as well as more optimistic scenes.

"All of this is not the scenery of a blockbuster about the apocalypse," he told the audience at the Hollywood Palladium, who, per Variety, were largely wealthy media figures. "All of this is our reality."

A video uploaded by Zelenskyy's office shows the speech intercut with audience reactions:

Former President Bill Clinton, Sharon Stone, and Los Angeles Mayor Eric Garcetti were among attendees at the dinner event, which also featured a performance by John Legend, Variety reported. Legend played Bob Marley's "Redemption Song" on piano, according to the outlet. 

It is unclear how much was raised in the auction, but one bidder managed to spend $1 million on a private home performance from Legend, per Variety."

https://businessinsider.com/zelenskyy-spoke-at-sean-penn-ukraine-fundraiser-raised-1m-2022-6

_source.content: White House Attempts To Distract From High Gas Prices By Putting Up Wacky Inflatable Tube Men In Front Of Price Signs June 11th, 2022 - http://BabylonBee.comWASHINGTON, D.C.‚ÄîThe White House has unveiled a new plan to deal with rising gas costs by installing a wacky inflatable tube man in front of every price sign across the country."Wow, look how much fun it is to go to the gas station now!" said Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. "These wacky guys are going to turn frowns upside-down at pumps everywhere. Sure is hard to be depressed about canceling your family vacation when those arms are flailing in the wind!"As gas prices continue to set records across America, the White House has been desperately brainstorming ways to not help and instead divert people's attention. "The problem is not our policies, the problem is that the media has done a terrible job communicating how great we are," said Press Secretary Karine Jeanne-Pierre. "We are doing incredible at forcing poor people to stop driving and using air conditioning, thus reducing our use of fossil fuels. But, short-sighted whiners that the poors are, they simply do not appreciate our help."After gas surged past five dollars per gallon, the decision was made to deploy the wacky, waving, inflatable arm-flailing tube men. "No way we are letting the fact people can't afford to live steal our January 6th thunder!" said Representative Eric Swalwell, swinging his nunchucks. "Soon as we re-hash the riot we have been ramming down everyone's throats for the last 18 months, America will love us again. You'll see!"At publishing time, Biden had come to blows with one of the inflatable tube men for failing to stay standing in the presence of the President. The tube man reportedly won the brawl handily.https://babylonbee.com/news/white-house-attempts-to-distract-from-high-gas-prices-by-putting-up-wacky-inflatable-tube-men-in-front-of-price-signs
_source.contentraw:
White House Attempts To Distract From High Gas Prices By Putting Up Wacky Inflatable Tube Men In Front Of Price Signs

June 11th, 2022 - http://BabylonBee.com

WASHINGTON, D.C.‚ÄîThe White House has unveiled a new plan to deal with rising gas costs by installing a wacky inflatable tube man in front of every price sign across the country.

"Wow, look how much fun it is to go to the gas station now!" said Transportation Secretary Pete Buttigieg. "These wacky guys are going to turn frowns upside-down at pumps everywhere. Sure is hard to be depressed about canceling your family vacation when those arms are flailing in the wind!"

As gas prices continue to set records across America, the White House has been desperately brainstorming ways to not help and instead divert people's attention. "The problem is not our policies, the problem is that the media has done a terrible job communicating how great we are," said Press Secretary Karine Jeanne-Pierre. "We are doing incredible at forcing poor people to stop driving and using air conditioning, thus reducing our use of fossil fuels. But, short-sighted whiners that the poors are, they simply do not appreciate our help."

After gas surged past five dollars per gallon, the decision was made to deploy the wacky, waving, inflatable arm-flailing tube men. "No way we are letting the fact people can't afford to live steal our January 6th thunder!" said Representative Eric Swalwell, swinging his nunchucks. "Soon as we re-hash the riot we have been ramming down everyone's throats for the last 18 months, America will love us again. You'll see!"

At publishing time, Biden had come to blows with one of the inflatable tube men for failing to stay standing in the presence of the President. The tube man reportedly won the brawl handily.

https://babylonbee.com/news/white-house-attempts-to-distract-from-high-gas-prices-by-putting-up-wacky-inflatable-tube-men-in-front-of-price-signs

There are no contradictions in The Word...EVER.

Tends to make one wonder why people gamble like that.

Meanwhile...The phrase of, ‚ÄúDo not be deceived...‚Äù is mentioned several times throughout Scripture. As sad as it is to say, people in cults and false religions are in the process of being deceived.

(SIDE NOTE: The term ‚ÄúChrist‚Äù is a title, not a name. It means either ‚ÄúThe Anointed One‚Äù or ‚ÄúMessiah‚Äù.)

Finally found time to check out #UncutGems, aka when #AdamSandler goes wrong. . .

The fourteen things that grabbed me:

1.) So, the Chinese run the #mine in #Ethiopia where the black #opal comes from? Figures. . .

2.) While I admire the filmmaking transition from the opal to the inside of Adam Sandler‚Äôs #colon, I hope I never see an opening sequence like that in a movie ever again. #TMI, man, #WTF. . . üëÄ üòÆ

3.) Speaking of WTF, how many F-bombs were dropped in this one? Didn‚Äôt bother me at all surprisingly. ü§¨ üòÇ

4.) Wow, #sports #betting can be a hell of a drug.

5.) I don‚Äôt care how beautiful the opal is, no way am I parting with my #NBA #championship #ring. . .

6.) You‚Äôve definitely made it when you get into fistfights with #TheWeeknd at the #nightclub. (And John Amos is your neighbor.)

7.) Sandler‚Äôs best scenes are with Eric Bogosian‚Äôs Arno Moradian, #loanshark and brother-in-law to Sandler‚Äôs Howard Ratner. Wish the movie explored that dysfunctional relationship more. Who needs enemies when you have #family?

8.) The same with Judd Hirsch as Gooey, Arno‚Äôs father-in-law. What‚Äôs his story? Would‚Äôve liked to have known more about him.

9.) Props to the Mohegan Sun clerk who didn‚Äôt bat an eye when thousands of dollars were dumped at her betting station. . .

10.) I know this #Celtics #playoff footage is from 2012. Doesn‚Äôt matter, I‚Äôm still yelling at the missed free throws.

11.) Great editing of the betting escape, trapping Arno and his henchmen Phil and Nico behind security doors, Howard watching the game in desperation. Superb #tension.

12.) Sheesh, Phil and Nico aren‚Äôt very bright, are they? üôÑ ü§¶‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è

13.) I think Howard‚Äôs girlfriend Julia should go on an impromptu vacation to the Caribbean and not come back. üòâ

14.) Random tangent - saw the trailers for ‚ÄúThe Lighthouse‚Äù and ‚ÄúGood Time‚Äù and figured out why #RobertPattinson is a good #actor. He changes his #voice to make it different and distinctive for each character.

card.title: Missouri Attorney General Subpoenas 7 School Districts Amid Worry Over Student Surveying

Wayfinder‚Äîto gather data about parents‚Äô political beliefs and income levels, as well as racial identity, sexual behaviors, and mental health.‚ÄúThose same groups come in and sell that curriculum to the schools,‚Äù said Kimberly Hermann, general counsel with Southeastern Legal Foundation, a national nonprofit law firm that defends liberty.‚ÄúThe contracts with these companies are public record so they‚Äôre supposed to be approved during school board meetings, but the surveys are happening without parental consent and parental notification.‚ÄùIn response, Schmitt has launched an District, Springfield School District, and Neosho School District‚Äîwith an eye on violations of Missouri‚Äôs Family Educational Right and Privacy Act (FERPA), or the Protection of Pupil Rights Amendment (PPRA).‚ÄúSubjecting students to personal, invasive surveys created by third-party consultants, potentially without parents‚Äô consent, is ridiculous and does nothing to further our inclusive?‚Äù‚ÄúThere are federal statutes that they‚Äôre not supposed to ask these questions,‚Äù said Andy Wells, the Missouri chapter president of No Left Turn in Education.‚ÄúThe problem is that school districts, and some of the companies that are being hired by school districts, don‚Äôt care. They just ignore it. They do it anyway and if somebody doesn‚Äôt like it, you‚Äôll have to sue them.‚ÄùSecond-grade students were asked: ‚ÄúWhen is the first time you noticed that people can be different races from you, what did you notice, and do you feel more comfortable around people who look like you?‚Äù‚ÄúThe goal here is to teach these kids that America is a white country of white supremacy and to destroy the nuclear family,‚Äù Hermann alleges. ‚ÄúIf bad actors in the progressive Left are not stopped, then we‚Äôre just going to have a further divide in this country among our kids.‚ÄùContinue https://www.theepochtimes.com/worry-over-student-surveying-leads-missouri-attorney-general-to-subpoena-seven-school-districts_4526142.html
_source.contentraw:
School surveys that collect information from students and create a perceived need for Social and Emotional Learning (SEL) curriculum have caught the attention of Missouri authorities.

Attorney General Eric Schmitt issued subpoenas this week to seven school districts that allegedly employ student surveys‚Äîcreated by education companies Panorama and Project Wayfinder‚Äîto gather data about parents‚Äô political beliefs and income levels, as well as racial identity, sexual behaviors, and mental health.

‚ÄúThose same groups come in and sell that curriculum to the schools,‚Äù said Kimberly Hermann, general counsel with Southeastern Legal Foundation, a national nonprofit law firm that defends liberty.

‚ÄúThe contracts with these companies are public record so they‚Äôre supposed to be approved during school board meetings, but the surveys are happening without parental consent and parental notification.‚Äù

In response, Schmitt has launched an investigation into the use of student surveys at Mehlville School District, Webster Groves School District, Jefferson City School District, Lee‚Äôs Summit R-7 School District, Park Hill School District, Springfield School District, and Neosho School District‚Äîwith an eye on violations of Missouri‚Äôs Family Educational Right and Privacy Act (FERPA), or the Protection of Pupil Rights Amendment (PPRA).

‚ÄúSubjecting students to personal, invasive surveys created by third-party consultants, potentially without parents‚Äô consent, is ridiculous and does nothing to further our children‚Äôs education,‚Äù Schmitt said in a statement online.

Hermann details in a May 1 letter to Schmitt that Webster Groves School District requires middle school students to take a survey on ‚ÄúLGBTQIA+ Struggles!‚Äù that asks: ‚ÄúWhat are your preferred pronouns, what struggles have you experienced related to LGBTQIA+, and what would you like to see in the school in order to be more inclusive?‚Äù

‚ÄúThere are federal statutes that they‚Äôre not supposed to ask these questions,‚Äù said Andy Wells, the Missouri chapter president of No Left Turn in Education.

‚ÄúThe problem is that school districts, and some of the companies that are being hired by school districts, don‚Äôt care. They just ignore it. They do it anyway and if somebody doesn‚Äôt like it, you‚Äôll have to sue them.‚Äù

Second-grade students were asked: ‚ÄúWhen is the first time you noticed that people can be different races from you, what did you notice, and do you feel more comfortable around people who look like you?‚Äù

‚ÄúThe goal here is to teach these kids that America is a white country of white supremacy and to destroy the nuclear family,‚Äù Hermann alleges. ‚ÄúIf bad actors in the progressive Left are not stopped, then we‚Äôre just going to have a further divide in this country among our kids.‚Äù

Continue https://www.theepochtimes.com/worry-over-student-surveying-leads-missouri-attorney-general-to-subpoena-seven-school-districts_4526142.html
